text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.8.4, Audit Information Management System (AIMS), AIMS Command Code AMSTU.
MATERIAL CHANGES
Cannot update account if Freeze Code 67-74 present.
) New error message: “PCC ONLY ALLOWED WITH INITIAL UPDATE TO STATUS CODE
) New error message: “ TIF STATUS-CD =
X, SCREEN PCC ONLY ALLOWED WITH INITIAL UPDATE TO STATUS-CD
) Removed error message: “CURRENT STATUS
- MUST USE SCREEN STATUS
Removed error message: “CURRENT STATUS 51 - MUST USE SCREEN STATUS 52-59”.
IRM 2.8.4, dated December 04, 2020, is superseded.

This IRM is intended for the general use of IDRS system personnel from all four Business Operating Divisions (W&I, SB/SE, LB&I and TE/GE) and Appeals accessing the Audit Information Management System.
Table of Contents

AIMS Command Code AMSTU 2.8.4

) This IRM section provides the instructions for the Audit Information Manage- ment System (AIMS) command code AMSTU. AMSTU updates the AIMS Data base as the case is moved through the AIMS system. AMSTU generates a TC
(FT) record for updates to the Assessment Statute Expiration Date (ASED) Employee Plans Master File (EPMF), Individual Master File (IMF) and Business Master File (BMF). AMSTUR generates a TC
(FF) record to IMF, BMF and EPMF when previously closed cases are re-opened onto the AIMS Data Base. AMSTUB generates a TC
(FD) record to change the Primary Business Code (PBC) at IMF, BMF and EPMF when a case that was previ- ously closed to Appeals is backed downed to an examination Status. AMSTU generates a TC
(F-) record when a case is moved from a Non-Docketed Appeals STATUS-CD to a Docketed Appeals STATUS-CD. AMSTU generates a TC

(F*) record when a case is updated from a Docketed Appeals STATUS-CD to a Non-Docketed Appeals STATUS-CD. AMSTUS generates an AIMS-STATUTORY-NOTICE to AIMS-BATCH processing when a Statutory Notice of Deﬁciency is generated (
) EOD, IMF, BMF, EPMF, RCCMS, RGS

This IRM section provides the instructions for the Audit Information Manage- ment System (AIMS) command code AMSTU. AMSTU updates the AIMS Data base as the case is moved through the AIMS system. AMSTU generates a TC 560 (FT) record for updates to the Assessment Statute Expiration Date (ASED) Employee Plans Master File (EPMF), Individual Master File (IMF) and

base as the case is moved through the AIMS system. AMSTU generates a TC 560 (FT) record for updates to the Assessment Statute Expiration Date (ASED) Employee Plans Master File (EPMF), Individual Master File (IMF) and Business Master File (BMF). AMSTUR generates a TC 420(FF) record to IMF, BMF and EPMF when previously closed cases are re-opened onto the AIMS Data Base. AMSTUB generates a TC 428 (FD) record to change the Primary Business Code (PBC) at IMF, BMF and EPMF when a case that was previ- ously closed to Appeals is backed downed to an examination Status. AMSTU generates a TC 520 (F-) record when a case is moved from a Non-Docketed Appeals STATUS-CD to a Docketed Appeals STATUS-CD. AMSTU generates a TC 521 (F*) record when a case is updated from a Docketed Appeals STATUS-CD to a Non-Docketed Appeals STATUS-CD. AMSTUS generates an AIMS-STATUTORY-NOTICE to AIMS-BATCH processing when a Statutory Notice of Deﬁciency is generated
2.8.4.1.1(12-18-2017) Terms/Deﬁnitions/Acronyms
) Command Code AMSTU is used to change or update several AIMS ﬁelds. The Appeals Office Code can be input using CC AMSTU when updating a PBBA case to Status
CC AMSTU is to be used only on cases where the status code on AIMS is in the range
It may be input as single or as batch pro- cessing. The input documents for AMSTU are Form
, Examination Update, for Examination and Form
, TE/GE Update, for EO, EP and GE.

1) For EGCs 1XXX, 2XXX and 5XXX and Disposal Code is 01-04, 07-13 or 34: a record cannot be extracted if closed within 20 days. A record can be extracted if closed from 20 to 39 days and it has been extracted for reports (RPT Ex- traction Code = 1). No restrictions if record closed more than 39 days.
There must not be any unveriﬁed assessment on the record. See IRM 2.8.4.11, Command Code AMSTUR.
This Command Code is used to zero-out the “AMSTU Update Counter” that is displayed with each Request-Completed message. It performs no other
) As stated, individual entries beginning with line

will be processed one at a time until all entries on the screen have been processed or until an error has been detected. If an error is encountered, the entire screen will be displayed back with the message “OK” in position
after each successful entry. Line entries which follow the ﬁrst erroneous entry will not be processed and position
and
will be blank when displayed. Line
will be reserved for “error messages ”. (

) When the input screen has been displayed back, the operator may correct any invalid line entry, clear asterisks, and re-enter the entire page. When re- entered, any line where the asterisks have not been cleared will of be processed and when the screen is displayed back “DR” will be in position
thru
Entry lines that have already been processed and are retransmitted with “OK” in positions
when displayed back the second time. (

) For each terminal, there is a
-character “AMSTU Update Counter”, used to keep track of AMSTU updates. The counter is incremented by one for each successful update for AMSTU, AMSTUA, AMSTUB, AMSTUR, AMSTUS and AMSTUP. (
) The total number of updates is displayed along with the Request Completed messages in the following format: “REQUEST COMPLETED/UPDATES nnnn”
2.8 Audit Information Management System (AIMS)
Whenever you wish to reset the counter to zero, enter AMSTUZ in positions 1-6 of line 1, and transmit the screen. The message returned will be: “REQUEST COMPLETED/UPDATES 0000”
Single Input Display
The data to be entered on lines 1 and 2 for single input, CC AMSTU, will be taken from a prepared “Label” which will be attached to the “AIMS Update Form ”.
(a) There are two ways to input batch data:

If update (Status Code, EGC, etc.) on the “batch data line” (line 1) of CC AMSTU is identical for every record to be updated, the individual records can be listed one after the other (one per line) on lines 2-23 of the terminal screen. Thus, up to 22 records can be updated with one screen input.
In order to update records with the same TIN but with different MFTs and/or Tax Periods; use AMSTU with the “repeat” function. This is done by entering an “R” in position
of the next available line of
After the “R”, you may input the MFT or the Tax Period or both. The TIN, File Source and Name Control will be taken from the last entry line above. Data lines
may be used for the “repeat” pro- cessing.

For both methods of input (above) the data input in the Amount Claimed ﬁeld, on the same line (2-23) as a record, is for that record only; it does not “carry down” or otherwise affect the other record updates.

Literal “Request Completed/Updates nnnn”

When cases are to be moved from Status 81 to an assigned status:
Fill out line of the input screen as per the Input Screen Display
) If a Work Unit No. is to be generated, leave element “
” blank.
) If an existing Work Unit No. is to be used, enter it in element “

the TIN, MFT, Tax Period (per Input Display) of each case the Work Unit speciﬁed on Line
If there are more than 22 cases in the same Work Unit, CC AMSTUA should be used again, repeating the generated Work Unit on the second input.
After a screen has been input and the “ENTER” Key has been depressed, the Work Unit No. (if it is to be generated) will appear on line 1 pos. 27 - 35 as nnn-nnnn.
Record the generate Work Unit Number on Form 5569 from screen display after input.

Input Display
eTiti
Elements 10 & 11 may occur 0–5 times in any order. No duplicate penalty types or blank lines between penalty types allowed.
